recommendations: Cindi Taylor
Agile Coach and Trainer, CSP, CSM, CSPO
February 13, 2017, John was senior to Cindi but didn’t manage directly

Cindi was instrumental to successfully transforming the Scholastic technology organization from waterfall to agile methods over the past few years. She was there through the entire process from establishing processes and practices, to proper use of tooling, to providing training to large and small groups, to providing detailed coaching to large numbers of teams with diverse challenges.I've been working with agile software engineering methods for over 15 years, and Cindi is one of the best professionals in this area I've ever seen. She is able to train and coach people and teams coming from a variety of different backgrounds and perspectives and to help them "be" agile not just "do" agile.It was a real pleasure to work with Cindi in the Scholastic world and I would gladly work with her again. She will be a major asset to any organization.

Aaron Zeckoski
VP Software Engineering for Healthcare Education at RELX Group
January 6, 2015, John was senior to Aaron but didn’t manage directly

Aaron is an insightful and talented software architect and I really miss working with him. He is always ready to tackle any challenge, provide strong leadership, and deliver inspired technical expertise. He aggressively tackles becoming an expert in any area, helping to build out our initial Learning Analytics practice on top of the Learning Management practice where he had long been a key leader. Aaron is an impressive community leader, working as a core committer to the open source Sakai project for years, among other significant open source participation. I sincerely hope to work with Aaron again in the future.

summary: John Lewis is the Chief Architect for Scholastic, where he leads the enterprise architecture for the major technology transformation initiatives to provide the current and emerging business capabilities needed across the company. John is a 20+ year veteran of the software engineering industry, with a passion for large-scale enterprise architecture, education technology, open source, and agile development methods. He has worked in and around both K-12 education and higher education since 1999. John previously spent ten years as the Chief Architect for Unicon, leading the technology strategy of the education-oriented systems integration firm. John is a founding member of the Board of Directors of the Apereo Foundation, which stewards a number of key open source projects and communities in education.
name: John Lewis
title: Chief Architect at Scholastic
